byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Pentagon officials say Russia has moved some of its most modern battle tanks to new air base in Syria, part of increasing buildup that could expand Russia's military presence in Middle East to its biggest in decades; move brings new friction to its relations with United States.
lead_paragraph: American officials said the movement of modern battle tanks into Syria was part of an escalating buildup that could give Moscow its most significant military foothold in the Middle East in decades.

headline.main: Russian Moves in Syria Widen Role in Mideast
headline.print_headline: Russian Moves in Syria Widen Role in Mideast

snippet: American officials said the movement of modern battle tanks into Syria was part of an escalating buildup that could give Moscow its most significant military foothold in the Middle East in decades.
